node.title: Astroworld Victims Include High Schoolers and a College Student
node.alt: People posted messages to victims on a gate outside the Astroworld festival site during a vigil on Saturday.
node.description: The music festival at Astroworld in Houston left eight people dead. Here is what is known about them so far.
node.content: ["Excitement and adrenaline soon turned to panic and horror as a crowd of 50,000 descended into chaos at the Astroworld music festival in Houston on Friday night. Unconscious bodies were lifted and surfed through the crowd, while other attendees begged for the concert to stop as they watched others around them collapse.", "Hundreds of people, including a 10-year-old child, suffered injuries. Some were rushed from the NRG Park in Houston, where the festival took place, to hospitals. By Saturday afternoon, Houston\u2019s mayor confirmed that 13 victims remain hospitalized, including five minors. ", "And eight people, ranging in age from 14 to 27, with one age unknown, were dead. Here is what we know about some of the lives that were lost. ", "Franco Patino, 21, a senior at the University of Dayton in Ohio, was among those who died at the music festival, the university and one of Mr. Patino\u2019s brothers confirmed.", "Mr. Patino, who was from Naperville, Ill., was majoring in mechanical engineering technology with a minor in human movement biomechanics, the university said in a campuswide email on Saturday. Mr. Patino was a member of the Society of Hispanic Professional Engineers and Alpha Psi Lambda, a Hispanic interest fraternity, the university said.", "A brother, Julio Patino Jr., said his younger brother was planning to pursue a career in biomedical engineering and had a particular interest in prosthetics. Julio Patino Jr. said his brother was active in volunteer work and regularly sought to help others.", "\u201cHe was just that type of person,\u201d he said. \u201cHe was always there for the people he cared about. He had a big heart.\u201d", "He described his brother as an avid video game player (\u201cCall of Duty\u201d was a favorite) who competed in football, rugby and wrestling in high school. He said his brother had been to other concerts without incident but that this was his first time attending the Astroworld festival.", "\u201cThis should have never happened,\u201d Julio Patino Jr. said of the deaths at the music festival. \u201cThere should be more rules in place to prevent this in the future. They should have stopped the concert right away as soon as all this started happening.\u201d", "Green ribbons appeared at Memorial High School, just outside of Houston. It was the favorite color of John Hilgert, 14, a freshman, who was the youngest person to die at Astroworld, according to the authorities. ", "He told friends that he wanted to get to the performance by the rapper Travis Scott early to get a good view, The Houston Chronicle reported. Now, family members, friends and former coaches were left to make sense of his death. On social media, those who knew Mr. Hilgert told similar stories of a young, kind boy who was known for being a good student and an athlete who played baseball and football. ", "\u201cThe kid impacted everyone that met him,\u201d Justin Higgs, a former baseball coach of Mr. Hilgert, wrote on Facebook. \u201cPrivileged to have had the opportunity to coach him during those seasons of his life.\u201d ", "Mr. Hilgert\u2019s principal, Lisa Weir, sent an email to the entire school the morning after the concert, identifying Mr. Hilgert as one of the victims. The school will have counselors available to talk to students. ", "\u201cHe was one of the nicest kids I knew and always made people laugh,\u201d a friend tweeted. ", "Brianna Rodriguez, 16, was a student at Heights High School in Houston and a member of the school band, which paid tribute to her Saturday on Twitter. ", "\u201cBrianna was someone who performed with the band and was someone who could always make anyone smile,\u201d the band said. \u201cAlthough she\u2019s gone and she cannot perform with us anymore, we know she\u2019d want to still enjoy our time in heights.\u201d", "In an automated phone call on Saturday to parents, the school\u2019s principal, Wendy L. Hampton, said that a student had died on Friday night while off campus and that grief counselors would be available. The call did not identify the student. ", "On a GoFundMe page raising money for funeral expenses, Ms. Rodriguez\u2019s family said that she was passionate about dancing.", "On Sunday, Erica Davis, a trustee for the Harris County Department of Education, shared photos of her on Twitter.", "\u201cThere is no level above Tragedy \u2026 my heart mourns for families and all who experienced this,\u201d Ms. Davis said. ", "Rudy Pe\u00f1a was identified by a cousin, Kimberly Escamilla, as being one of the victims. \u201cRip to my cousin,\u201d she wrote in a Facebook post, \u201cyou will be missed.\u201d She described him as \u201calways smiling and so nice.\u201d ", "His sister, Jennifer Pe\u00f1a, told The Laredo Times that he was \u201cthe sweetest person, friendly, outgoing.\u201d She said that Mr. Pe\u00f1a had been taken to Ben Taub Hospital in Houston, where staff members told Mr. Pe\u00f1a\u2019s mother that he had died. ", "The brother of Danish Baig described him in a Facebook post as a \u201cbeautiful soul\u201d who put \u201ceveryone before himself.\u201d", "\u201cI am scarred for life,\u201d said the brother, Basil Mirza Baig. \u201cYou were my role model, and I have so much pain in my heart. I can\u2019t believe I lost you.\u201d", "Basil Baig, who attended the festival, said his brother died as he tried to save a sister-in-law from \u201chorrendous things that were being done.\u201d People were \u201ctrampled, walked and stomped on,\u201d he wrote.", "\u201cIn this time of mourning and grief and such pain, I would like everyone to pray for my family and my brother,\u201d he wrote. "]
